author: Michael Larabel
description: Last month saw the release of Rust 1.87 that celebrated ten years of the Rust programming language while out today is Rust 1.88 that continues iterating the language with new features...
title: Rust 1.88 Released With Improvements For Naked Functions, Chaining Let Statements

author: Michael Larabel
description: A decade ago Canonical did around $81 million in revenue (2014) with a head count of around 337 at the company behind Ubuntu Linux while their Linux desktop efforts were still gaining a footing with OEMs/ODMs pre-loads, within enterprise desktop environments, and the lucrative server/cloud space. Canonical recently filed their 2024 annual report and they are now up to almost $300 million USD in revenue and a headcount of more than 1,100...
title: Ubuntu Maker Canonical Generated Nearly $300M In Revenue Last Year

author: Michael Larabel
description: Published last November as part of Vulkan 1.3.302 was the VK_KHR_video_encode_av1 extension for adding AV1 video encoding to the Vulkan Video API. Ahead of next quarter's Mesa 25.2 release, the open-source Radeon Vulkan driver "RADV" has merged its AV1 encode support...
title: Mesa 25.2 RADV Driver Merges Support For AV1 Vulkan Video Encode

author: Michael Larabel
description: Building off the release of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 (RHEL 10.0) just over one month ago, Oracle today announced the general availability of Oracle Linux 10.0...
title: Oracle Linux 10 Reaches GA, Available With Unbreakable Enterprise Kernel 8.1

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following this week's release of Firefox 140, Firefox 141 was promoted to beta. Most exciting for Linux users with next month's Firefox 141 release is finally lowering system RAM use! I've been running some benchmarks looking at the impact.
title: Firefox 141 Beta Lowering RAM Use On Linux But Still Benchmarking Behind Chrome

author: Michael Larabel
description: Last month Canonical announced plans for releasing monthly Ubuntu Linux development snapshots and was followed by the Questing Snapshot 1 release in the road toward Ubuntu 25.10. Out today is the Questing Snapshot 2 release for incorporating the latest Ubuntu 25.10 development changes...
title: Ubuntu 25.10 Snapshot 2 Released

author: Michael Larabel
description: As a follow-up to the article a few weeks ago about AMD enabling User CPUID Faulting support for Linux, that code looks like it's ready to go for being introduced in the upcoming Linux 6.17 kernel...
title: AMD CPUID Faulting Support Looks To Be Coming For Linux 6.17
